headline: Banana Sour Cream Bread
description: This banana bread recipe with sour cream makes 4 super moist loaves with a delicious tangy flavor. They freeze well and make a wonderful gift!

video.description: Add a little sour cream for a deliciously different banana bread.
video.name: Banana Sour Cream Bread

name: Banana Sour Cream Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Grease four 7x3-inch loaf pans.
Mix 1/4 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon together in a small bowl until well combined; dust the greased pans lightly with sugar mixture.

Beat remaining 3 cups sugar and butter together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Add mashed bananas, sour cream, eggs, vanilla, and remaining 2 teaspoons cinnamon; continue to beat until well-blended. Add flour, baking soda, and salt; mix until just combined. Stir in walnuts and divide batter evenly into the prepared pans.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, about 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: I give this a 5 star. I have used this recipe for many years. I used to think my mother's was the best. But this has become my go to now. I add lemon juice and an extra splash of vanilla. But overall, this is the best for me and the many who ask me to make one for them, or ask for the recipe.
This is a fantastic recipe. It‚Äôs very moist. I reduced the sugar by 1 Cup and added two cups of chocolate chips. Definitely a keeper!
Super moist tasty banana bread! Loved the dusting of the pan with the cinnamon sugar. Made 1/2 recipe and shared a loaf with the neighbors who also raved about it! Keeping this one!!!
THE BEST BANANNA BREAD......EVER !!!! Easy to make.
This is my go to for banana bread! All my friends and family love it!
fantastic and a big enough recipe to share with friends!
I make this recipe regularly. I always hear, "This is the best banana bread I have ever had!" This is definitely a go to recipe.
This truly is the most amazing recipe! What makes it the best ever is lining the pans with sugar and cinnamon AND the sour cream add. When I gift these loaves, friends are always excited!

Great recipe, but makes a lot of bread. I 1/2 the recipe and poured it into a pudding ring, and also made 6 cupcakes. I also made the sour cream using heavy cream and lemon juice (and a pinch of salt).
Love this recipe. I use half the sugar and then take a sugar cinnamon mixture, butter the pans and the spread sugar cinnamon mix as the duster. Then I sprinkle it on top of the bread before baking.
I added cranberries but it‚Äôs the best banana bread I‚Äôve ever eaten!
Absolutely DELICIOUS. Made as per recipe but added chocolate chips! Definitely will be my go to banana bread recipe!

I have made this a whole lot of times over the years and everyone loves it. Definitely a keeper! I stir chocolate chips into my batter and put cinnamon and sugar on top of the loaves before baking too.
Very delicious and sooo moist! Thank you!
This recipe is the best that I've ever tried. It is super moist and very tasteful. I did add a couple extra bananas and extra walnuts to mine. But still the best recipe.

BEST Banana Bread Recipe ever!! It‚Äôs the sour cream that makes it so tasty & moist. I‚Äôve played around with this recipe & subbed Greek yogurt for the sour cream & it was just as good. I‚Äôve subbed buttermilk for the sour cream & still tasty but not as dense. Could 1/2 the sugar & sub applesauce for other 1/2 but then use 5 (not 6) bananas. Not as sweet but is somewhat fruity from applesauce. I usually have at least 6 bananas in my freezer.üòè GREAT RECIPE!

I've made this recipe for years and each time it's a hit. But I alter it a bit. I replace 1 cup of sugar with 1 cup of light brown sugar to make it a bit richer. We like to have muffins so I make a dozen muffins - or less so they're high and puffy. I do not use the cinnamon sugar mix on the pan, instead I sprinkle the tops of the breads just before baking. I also add finely chopped nuts to the topping and press it gently into the tops of the breads and muffins. To bake the muffins, I preheat the oven at 450 degrees and lower it to 350 degrees when I put the muffins in. They are perfect after 25 minutes when tested with a toothpick. For the 3 remaining loaves, I set my second oven at 350 degrees instead of 300 degrees. The loaves are ready in 45 mins. - again tested with a toothpick. Of course, if you only have one oven, you can cover the unbaked breads with a lightly greased sheet of plastic wrap so the dough doesn't start to dry out while you wait for your oven to be ready.
This is such a good banana (or any flavor you want, adjusting the recipe accordingly)! I have made it a fee times and sticking with it. So moist and not overly sweet.
Excellent recipe! I made it exactly as it was written. I will be making it again and again! Thank you for this wonderful recipe.
Loved this, cooked it at 325. Added the topping off the zucchini bread recipe on this sight. added walnuts also!!
I love this recipe. I finally found a way to review it. My All Recipes doesn‚Äôt have the option.
Delicious! Thank you!
Best recipe until now, I had been trying others in the past but this one is the best one of all
I made this recipe, for the guys at work, they freaked out, I did put about 2 teaspoons of bourbon in the mixed bananas, and a pinch of nutmeg. Now I have to make more,lol.

Following as is will get you an overly sweet and mushy product. Multiple loaves of it, in fact. What a waste of ingredients. This recipe does not deserve the high ratings. I am not one to leave bad reviews but this is so disappointing that I had to. I can't get over the high rating. Do not recommend this

It came out perfect, but I did make a few changes. Changed the temp to 350, used homemade Greek yogurt instead of sour cream, and cut the sugar to 1 1/4 cups. Added walnuts and dried cranberries. Still baked for an hour, but lightly covered with aluminum foil for the last 15 minutes. Sprinkled with cinnamon sugar on the top as well. It was moist and plenty sweet. The recommended 3 cups seemed a bit much.
I did not make any changes to the recipe. It came out beautifully and was really yummy!!

I just love this recipe, I have made it 100x already well pretty close anyways.. I get requests for it all the time especially around the holidays. I make them in small bread pans and give them out. Sometimes ill add some glazing on top and most the time dont, either way is so delish. Tx for this recipe. Oldie but goodie.
Amazing Recipe. Absolutely the best Banana Bread I've ever had.! Throw all the other recipes away! This is it!
This is the 2nd time heading to my 3rd time tonight making this awesome recipe.. hands down delicious. Everyone that has had a piece said its fantastic..

This made 2 large loaf pans and 8 mini loafs. I did not have 4 loaf pans. the Mini loafs were fully cooked in 45 minutes and the regular loafs took 1 hour 10 minutes. It is VERY LARGE and would recommend decreasing, if possible, to half of the recipe.
The best ever banana bread! Absolutely magnificent taste!

My brother makes this bread all the time so I knew it would be great! My only problem is who has a 7x3 pans? My pans are 8x4 (on the base). I filled them a little over half full and INCREASED the temp to 325 and decreased the time by a quarter, but needed the full hour in the end. I also used half sour cream and half 0% plain Greek yogurt. I want to do all Greek yogurt next time to add some protein since my kids will be eating this for breakfast. It's SO good!

Made it in two larger pans. Had to cook for about 75 minutes. Absolutely delicious! Very moist and sugar on outside was a good touch. My kids and wife ate it up. I have ordered some 3x7 pans and will make it again.

I followed the recipe but I used 3 larger loaves. I baked it at 325¬∞ for 1 hour . I put a toothpick in each loaf it looked good nice and brown. I cooled and sliced the loaf it came out great. Then I sliced closer to the center the bottom was raw what a waste. All those ingredients and I only got end slices from the loaf. It tasted great but I will not make again. Giving bad directions for this recipe 300¬∞ is ridiculously low. So it's up to us to guess the right temperature. No thanks
Recipe is fantastic, but oven temp. should be 350 degrees.

I now never use another recipe for banana bread...This is the best recipe ??

I add mini semi sweet chocolate chips & add Greek Yogurt instead of sour cream.
best banana bread you will ever make.....seriously delicious

This was a great recipe. The sour cream kept the bread very moist.
 I did make two changes, they are as follows:

1. For the sugar, I replaced the 3 cups of white sugar with 2 cups of dark brown sugar. 
2. For the nuts, I used one heaping cup of pecans and one heaping cup of walnuts.

Another thing I like about this recipe is that it yields some to keep and plenty to share.

Thank you!
Awesome taste.....will bake this in the future!

Note: posted earlier review‚Ä¶forgot to add that I accidentally cooked at 350 at 45 minutes, with stove at ‚Äúconvection‚Äù setting. I live at 7,000 feet. It was perfect, didn‚Äôt flatten. 

Holiday 2021, and I‚Äôve made tons of these. It is hard to mess up. I‚Äôve made, 1, 2, and 3 quantity versions using a 5 x 7. No stick pans. 

As per other readers, I use brown sugar, cloves, nutmeg, and ginger. 

Great addition is the sugary crust when sugar and cinnamon is rubbed on the pans side and bottoms. I use butter instead of oil.
I let cook 10 extra minutes because the middle was not done. I used a commercial 4 loaf pan. it was the perfect size!
This has been my go to recipe for years. Everyone always asks for the recipe. This is sooo good. Even with four loaves, it goes quickly in my house. Thank you for sharing this!

This is the best banana bread, super moist. I followed the recipe exactly except for replacing one of the tsp. of vanilla extract with a tsp. of banana extract. It didn't seem to make the bread taste any more banana-y, so next time I'll just do two tsp. of banana extract and leave out the vanilla extract entirely. I sprinkled sugar and cinnamon on top of each loaf before baking. The recipe made 2 large loaves and one smaller loaf of bread. I baked them at 325 degrees for exactly 1 hour and all three loaves were perfect, totally cooked in the middle but not crunchy on the edges or burned on top.
Love it and make it all the time, my additions- yogurt, coconut flakes, and coconut extract, chocolate, and white chips, and lots of nuts!
This bread is wonderful. Full of flavor and very moist. My dad cannot stop eating it. This is a keeper.
Half brown sugar, used blender for wet ingredients and a large cake pan. Delicious

Awesome recipe. I don‚Äôt have -and couldn‚Äôt find- the size loaf pan called for so I used a slightly larger width and watched it as it neared time. The cinnamon sugar in the pan was a fantastic addition!
Terrible recipe, the worse I have ever made! Bread was so wet, and seemed undercooked although it passed the toothpick test. What a waste of time and ingredients!
I'm definingly making this again

Halved the recipe and accidentally added a lot of nutmeg but it turned out great! It made one loaf and about 10 cupcakes (I didn't have a second loaf pan) but the cupcakes cooked a lot faster so be sure to watch them. I also added a 5.3oz greek yogurt that I had in the fridge, thinking it might be too much with the sour cream but the end result was moist and delicious. Will definitely use this recipe again!
A little too sweet for our liking, will reduce the amount of sugar next time. It was so moist and delicious though, definite keeper.
This recipe is awesome my friends at school love it and even request it!
Yummy I also added berries on top before putting into the oven they did not last long have to do some more

This is my go to banana bread recipe! Follow the directions exact and you won‚Äôt go wrong!! I‚Äôve made it exactly as directed many times and it‚Äôs always delicious. I‚Äôve also used it as a base recipe and added my own flare and it still never disappoints. If you‚Äôre hunting for a good recipe, stop now and make this one!

Great recipe, but I did make a change on the temperature and time and I have some info for those who may not want to make it in a loaf pan. First off, I changed the temperature to 135 and baked my loaf for 70 mins. I also made (because I didn‚Äôt have several loaf pans) 12 muffins-baked at 135 for 50 mins AND I baked the remaining batter in a round non-stick cake pan for 30 mins. - this cake pan ‚Äúloaf‚Äù turned out the best to me. I did make extra of the sugar/brown sugar mixture and sprinkled on top before baking (you could also put it on after baking by buttering the top of the loaf before sprinkling with the sugar mixture). On another note, I used an electric hand mixer on slow for all of the mixing and it turned out great. Lastly, because my family loves chocolate chips, I use those rather than walnuts.
Very rich, dense, and delicious!
I Halved the recipe and since I only had 1 bread pan I put all the batter in that . However I still don't think it should have taken 2.5 hours to bake and still not be done all the way through
Best banana bread I've ever tasted.

My 3 teens all said this is THE best banana bread recipe EVER. I did reduce the sugar to 2 cups, added a crumble on top, and spread the batter between two loaf pans and a large muffin pan. The great thing about that is that the muffins were done in 30 minutes, so we got to sample them early. The loaves did take the full 75 minutes at 325, as other reviewers suggested. I placed a big foil roasting pan over the loaves to reduce browning during the last 20 minutes of bake time (just had it hanging around, but will remember it next time because it was way easier than fighting with a foil tent in a hot oven!)

Thankfully the bread turned out well, but only because I managed to read one of the reviews in time. 300 degrees in my oven doesn‚Äôt cover it. I think it‚Äôs more like 350 degrees for 30-45 minutes depending on if the oven has a convection option.

Thus has been my go to recipe for some years. I often substitute 1 cup of flour for cocoa powder for chocolate banana bread. It is easily made GF by using GF flour, also. I use oat flour usually- perhaps just a scant less bc it is a heartier flour. I also often add a TB of ground flax.

This is the third time I've made this recipe and I had to half it because I only had 3 ripe bananas. It was easy enough to do, however, the loaves were fairly small this time. I follow the comment to bake it at 325 for an hour and ten minutes and it turns out perfectly. Thanks for the recipe, it's the only one I'll use from now on!
Excellent flavor and texture. I did add pecans and also some mini chocolate chips. Baked at 325 as suggested by others, and it came out beautifully.

Oh my goodness!! This is so delicious!!! I‚Äôve made it a bunch of times but only do half the recipe. Two loaves is plenty at a time. Only banana bread recipe I‚Äôll make for the rest of my life!! Mmmmmmm YUMMY!!

I made it and cut the recipe in half. I only used 1/2 the sugar amount but used truvia instead. 4 bananas and put the temp at 325* I also added a touch of cloves and nutmeg as well. My family had both loaves devoured within a few hours.

Very disappointed. It did not cook properly at the suggested temperature - and remained very doughy, - much of it, unedible. I would suggest a hotter oven than the 300 degrees indicated, and perhaps the addition of some baking powder.
My go to banana bread recipe, delicious!
Best banana bread recipe!!! Thank You!!!

Great recipe! Light and flavorful!

For 1/2 batch, I halved the ingredients with exception: I used full stick unsalted butter, 2 eggs and 3 mashed bananas. :)
I added nutmeg and cloves. Took a whileee to cook, but tasted really good. Added the crumb topping as suggested. Amazing!
I made 3 mini loaves and dry canned 6 half pint jars for later. They last 6 months this way but my son always eats it way before that. Love this recipe!

This has been my go to banana bread recipe every since I found it here 6 or so years ago! I‚Äôll never make another recipe again and I make it exactly like the recipe. No applesauce or Splenda etc., go real or go home. Everyone who eats it wants the recipe! It‚Äôs so moist and delicious! I don‚Äôt put nuts on mine or my husband won‚Äôt eat it, otherwise he can‚Äôt get enough.

This is a wonderful recipes. I read a lot of the reviews and followed a few of the changes recommended by others. Some changes for healthy reasons, and some for a better baking. It was so well received with some saying it was the best banana bread they‚Äôd ever had. The first change is that I used a Bundt pan instead of two loaf pans, which I sprayed with coconut oil and dusted with a cinnamon/sugar mixture. In terms of recipe changes, I did cut the recipe in half, but I only had 2 bananas which worked out fine. I used only 2 tablespoons of butter along with 1/2 cup applesauce. I cut the sugar to 3/4 cup. I used 2 eggs, and substituted plain nonfat Greek yogurt for the sour cream. I used pecans instead of walnuts. I mixed pecan into the batter but also laid pecans in the bottom of the Bundt pan before pouring in the batter. I baked the bread at 350 and set the timer for an hour but the tester came out clean at about 50 minutes. Next time I‚Äôll check it earlier. I‚Äôll definitely make this my ‚Äúgo to‚Äù banana bread.
Best banana bread I've tasted!! So moist!

Incredible recipe! Truly I can no longer appreciate regular banana bread after trying this for the first time. The only advice I have for this recipe or any other baking of sweets is adding a wedge of lemon. The acid breakers the protein down and makes it silky smooth. Even after a day or two on the counter, it just doesn‚Äôt dry up (partially because of the sour cream.) try this once and it‚Äôll change you...
I made this twice and both times my loaves caved in the middle. I‚Äôm not sure if it was the recipe or a bad of baking soda, so I‚Äôm giving this 3 stars. The part that was finished was good.

The BEST reciepe that I have come across that avoids margin and other nutritional undesirables.
I prefer less sweet bread therefore even with 1/2 the sugar it is an amazingly, perfect Banana Bread.
Blended all the ingredients up until add flower step and divided the mixture in 2 since we have a Gluten intolorent member in the family. After 1 hour, with Gluten Free flour and with traditional wheat flower... WOW what a treat for everyone!!! Moist, flavorful, delicate, just can't go wrong!!! Bravo. Can't imagine anyone could not do amazingly well with this reciepe.

I have used this recipe for many years. I normally double the recipe because so many family and friends want a loaf for Christmas. For the past several years I have substituted half of the sugar with coconut sugar and no one has noticed. Awesome recipe!
Oh yeah I did, followed recipe to a T. Merry Christmas my friends
I had trouble finding the right size loaf pan, so the cook time was off and took longer than the recipe called for.
This banana bread is moist & has great texture. The cinnamon-sugar coating is a nice addition. My favorite!
I don‚Äôt understand how people think they can change the recipe and expect it to come out exactly as the original recipe is supposed to come out. I followed the recipe to a T. It was great?
Easy to make and turned out very moist! I added chocolate chips and served it as a dessert.

My bread had trouble cooking all the way through- I put it in a little longer and added Tun foil and it turned out great! I also made muffins because I didn‚Äôt have enough bread pans and those only took about 40 minutes to be done (I just had to watch them)
Fantastic recipe and easy to follow, even for a single father of 2!

This recipe is absolutely delicious and easy to change into a smaller batch. Cannot count the number of times i have made it in the past year! Great as a treat for our family and I make an extra to share with neighbours.

I also swap out the nuts for chocolate chips to make it school lunch friendly.

Yummy! I went off recipe a but, but then I usually do. I used Greek yogurt instead of sour cream. As other reviews suggested...I lowered the sugar. I put 1 1/2 cups white sugar and about half cup brown sugar. I replaced half the butter with about 3/4 cups applesauce - mostly to conserve my butter stash and use up the last bit of applesauce in the fridge. Made 36 muffins and one small loaf. Since I have a convection oven, 300 degrees was perfect, and of course the muffins were done much sooner than loaves of bread. I dove into one of the muffins as soon as it came out and was almost too hot to eat, but super delicious!
I has so much sour cream I needed a use. This recipe was halved and made in a large cast iron skillet. This recipe is amazing!

I scaled this recipe down to 12 servings as I only had two large bananas and it turned out awesome! It did need two loaf pans which I only had one, so I used a round cake pan and it turned out great! I highly recommend this recipe!

Made this last night exactly as described, sans the walnuts, including dusting the loaf pans. Doesn't everyone keep cinnamon sugar in the spice rack? It made a nice sticky glase on the bread. The smell of cinnamon filled the house and drove me crazy! I made three 5"x9" loaves which took about 1 hr 20 minutes to bake but they came out great. Took one into work this morning and it was gone by 9:00 am. People were asking for the recipe. We have tons of bananas in the yard this time of year and this is a great way to use them! Thanks for the recipe!
The banana loaf is excellent. I cooked it at 350 not 300!!!
Easy recipe. I used my mini loaf pan and got 16 loaves out of this!
This recipe is awesome everyone loves it! Although I don't understand why it says to bake at 300, I changed that and baked mine at 350 for about 40 min and it turned out fine.

I chose this recipe because #1 it had a great rating. #2 because I had bananas that needed to use up and #3 because I had sour cream that needed to be used up. I halved the recipe and made one loaf and 6 muffins. Not sure if the ingredients were exactly halved such as the butter and the sour cream but it came out REALLY well ! My husband even loved it and he doesn‚Äôt normally go for stuff like this. So kudos to the one who came up with this recipe ! Thanks so much !
Excellent banana bread. I would say it is more of a cake.
I cut down on the sugar. I didn't have loaf pans so I just used what I had. It didn't have as much flavor as I thought it would. Since it has so much banana. With a bit of jam it should be fine.

Moist and soft. Excellent recipe. I cut it in half and it was plenty. Added a crumble on top for extra sweetness (1/3 cup brown sugar, 2 tablespoons flour, mix and add one tablespoon of creamed butter- mix until you get a crumble, add on top then bake).

I love this recipe and it‚Äôs great as is but I like to use 1 1/2 cups brown sugar and 1 1/2 cups regular sugar instead of 3 cups regular. I also add the crumb topping as others have and add extra apple pie spice in addition to the cinnamon. My key ingredient is a bag of cinnamon chips- this makes it!
